name: clerkly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
like or typical of a clerk (= someone who works in an office): He enclosed a note, explaining in his clerkly style that it was only a rough estimate of the cost. The list, written in a clerkly hand, described the property of someone called "Patrick Seton Esquire".
More examplesFewer examplesHe worked hard and had a clerkly attention to detail.His praise for the clerkly class does little to reassure the modern reader.The room contained computers, filing cabinets, and two clerkly men sitting at desks.
